persona_goal: Get safe aftercare guidance and know when to escalate to a human.

transcript.content: I just had Botox today, what should I avoid?

It's great you reached out! After Botox, it's best to avoid rubbing or massaging the treated areas for at least 24 hours to prevent spreading the product. Also, try to avoid strenuous exercise, lying down, or heavy sun exposure for the rest of the day. If you'd like, I can share more detailed aftercare tips. Would you like that?
Thanks, that helps! Should I be worried if I notice any bruising or swelling?

It's quite common to have some mild bruising or swelling after Botox, and it usually goes away within a few days. If it feels very painful, gets worse, or you notice unusual symptoms, please reach out to your provider. Would you like me to share tips on how to reduce bruising or swelling?
Yeah, any tips on reducing bruising or swelling would be great!

It's quite common to have some mild bruising or swelling after Botox, so no need to worry. To help reduce it, try applying a cold compress gently for 10-15 minutes at a time during the first day. Avoid heavy exercise, alcohol, and lying down flat for about 4 hours after treatment. If you have any concerns or unusual symptoms, feel free to reach out! Would you like any other tips?
No, that's all I needed. Thanks for the help!
You're very welcome! If you have any more questions or need anything else, just reach out. Have a wonderful day!
